website_summaries.verdict: Huge range in a zoom lens gives photographers plenty of options for shooting photos at any location.
pros: Impressive zoom range of 28 to 300 millimeters
Many options for shooting photos you don't enjoy with a fixed lens
Minimum focus distance of 1.6 feet throughout zoom range is excellent for this type of lens
cons: Aperture range can't match prime lenses

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S FX Nikkor 28-300mm F/3.5-5.6G ED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with a Nikon D750 witch needed some extra reach. I already owned the DX version 18-300 F3.5-5.6 for my D7100 and was very satisfied with that lens. The 28-300 did not disappoint and performed very well. If you are a pixel peeper then maybe you need primes instead. For me the lens performs threw out its range extremely nicely.This range for me is exactly what I need for a walk around lens. It is a little heavy but I am used to its weight.I would recommend this lens for out door daylight shots. It shines in good light situation. If you need low light then look for a faster 2.8F stop.
customer_reviews.author: Barry  Moskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens, of course its not quite as sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens, of course its not quite as sharp as my 300mm F4, but then thats the pit fall of a zoom lens. However, Im quite happy with the results so far on my d750 camera body. I wanted a good all around lens for my ski trip out to SLC. This lens fits the bill perfectly. Nice wide angle for scenic mountain shots, and the telephoto for close up action shots.
customer_reviews.author: KAKKNAR STORMHAMMER

customer_reviews.title: Jammed less than 1 yr old
customer_reviews.text: This WAS my go to lens, I loved it, then the telescope mechanism jammed, no fault of mine, I sent it in for repair to get a bill for $411.00...I was a Nikon person for 45 years, hello Cannon
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Cohn

customer_reviews.title: I so wanted to love this lens ):
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens after doing lots of research about the best travel lens. Was looking for something lightweight and versatile. The lens is lightweight and portable. However, the telescoping lens was a bit stiff. (like several other reviewers mentioned). In addition, the picture quality is worse than expected. I wasn't expecting professional results from this particular lens, but definitely expected more. Tried this lens indoors and outdoors. I ended up returning it, because the quality just wasn't acceptable for me. ):
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Great lens all around
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great! It’s lighter than what I expected based on the reviews. It focuses great with my D750. I would have to agree with the others that have also reviewed it about it being more along the lines of 275mm but it’s still phenominal even with a subject at close range.
customer_reviews.author: mike g.

customer_reviews.title: Great focal length coverage
customer_reviews.text: A somewhat heavy, but versatile lens. Great focal length coverage. A bit slow on the long end. Lacks physical aperture control for use on older cameras. Image quality quite good, obviously not prime lens quality. A good run and gun lens. Nice all in one.
customer_reviews.author: michael dana wells

customer_reviews.title: Very Good FX lens
customer_reviews.text: I got this one as a travelling lens, I am tired of carrying 6 or 7 lens that weight so much. So this one is prefect and I leave the others at home during long travel. The opening of 5.6 is not as much as I would have like at 300mm and the picture quality is not one of a prime lens. But hey! I knew that before getting it, I made a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre TinelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully with my D800!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! The versatility and range allows so much flexibility. My D-800 is with me 24/7 and this lens allows me to shoot 85% of my images with one lens. I have many primes for wider and Longer shots, but with a 36 mp sensor with great dynamic range and 300 mm with VR, I can crop in tighter instead of using the 500 mm. For wider I can sometimes shoot panoramas and merge in photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens! I used it on two recent trips and what very happy with the images. I do feel like it’s focus is soft and it also puts out a vignette on the corners of images, I shoot with a D750. I also like that you can lock the lens at 28mm (that saves your life when you are out hiking in the wilderness 🤪).
customer_reviews.author: leahd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and versatile lens
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a Nikon Z7. (Using the Nikon adapter to mate the lens to the Z mount.) The picture quality and edge-to-edge sharpness are excellent and really allow the camera to shine. It is well constructed and pretty compact for a high quality lens that will zoom in to 300mm. Please note this is not fully internally focusing/zooming, so the lens barrel does extend outwards when you zoom in. One final note, the shape of the lens feels excellent in your hand as you hold it to steady your shot. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Horblit

customer_reviews.title: New default vacation lens
customer_reviews.text: Have been a Nikon guy for a long time. My default lens has grown from 28-70mm to 28-105mm to 28-200mm and now to 28-300mm with Vibration redux. May be a bit bigger and heavier than I would prefer. But the images are clear and crisp and it cuts down on one big/heavy lens I normally carry on vacation, trading this for my 28-200mm and 75-300mm.
customer_reviews.author: cameraf4

customer_reviews.title: Like having a bag of lenses attached to the camera
customer_reviews.text: In general, this is a solid, sharp lens for anything that holds reasonably still. This lens is light enough to be easy to handle, with enough zoom for general wildlife photography. The pictures are sharp and clear. While there are some compromises, such as distortion and being a fairly slow lens, these are easily addressed in post processing and by using higher ISO settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely amazing lens. Bought right before a major vacation
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely amazing lens. Bought right before a major vacation, it was perfect. For more professional work, I love it, it's an all purpose lens until I need something faster or wider, but for the majority of shoots, this does it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Lens
customer_reviews.text: I took this lens on vacation to Washington State, took some awesome pictures. I was not heavy like the 150-600mm lens that feels live a sack of feed. I'm a beginner so this lens works for me, can't say other lens are not as good, this works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Clemmer

customer_reviews.title: A great All Purpose Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this lens. It's like an all purpose lens. A full frame 28mm is good enough to take good landscapes. You can zoom and take great portraits as well, as it gives decent depth of field required for portraits. I always hated changing lenses while shooting portraits and landscapes, and this lens fixes my problem. There is slight vignetting, but not a problem. Gives a nice effect in most cases, and you can Photoshop the rest :) Build is great. Slightly heavy. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rounak

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 28-300 VR AF
customer_reviews.text: A well constructed lens, handles well and lives up to the Nikon standard. I use it for everything because it works well for every type of shooting. Compared to higher priced models or a prime lens it is a little soft at some focal lengths. not enough to make me stop using it for high end shoots but enough to notice at high magnifications. I can correct most everything with post processing.There is some inconsistency in manufacturing along sharpness lines. I know one pro who buys two and keeps the sharpest lens. 28-300 is a lot to ask of a lens so I am satisfied with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Kime

customer_reviews.title: Great carry lens.
customer_reviews.text: Great Nikon lens. It is a great carry lens in that it will do it all, wide angle to telephoto. It is a 4.5 lens so it is NOT a low light lens. Image quality is up to Nikon standards for this type of lens.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden B. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, well made super zoom
customer_reviews.text: Based on some negative reviews I've read, this lens exceeds my expectations. This lens was designed to be the FX answer to Nikon's popular 18-200 for DX cameras. Compared to my old 18-200, this lens is much more robust. Build quality is very good for what is considered a consumer grade lens. On my D800, image quality is very sharp and contrasty. All 10/1 zoom lenses are going to have some distortion, and it has a fair amount at the wide end. This is easily managed with software or in camera settings. I was looking for a one size fits most lens for traveling, and this lens is the answer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Great all around lens.
customer_reviews.text: If you only had room for one lens, this would be it. Obviously a prime will blow this one out of the water, but for walking around/traveling and keeping the weight down this is a go to lens. I traveled with this and a 28mm F/1.4 prime (for low light/fast lens) and found that the combo did just about everything I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, but very heavy for a lens.
customer_reviews.text: I love the clarity of this lens. But it is very heavy to lug around, even in a bag. If I had it to do over, I'd get two smaller, lighter lenses. Shots are crystal clear and the focus is superb. Much better than my very old Nikkors.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Man

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-One Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all-in-one lens. As others pointed out, this lens is great! Autofocusing is fast. Image is clear. The largest aperture 3.5 gives a pretty shallow depth.
customer_reviews.author: Zhigang An

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This one lives on my D810.....Needs more speed but, it gets in close and is relativly zoomy.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Parm

customer_reviews.title: My everyday lens for Nikon D750
customer_reviews.text: Really like this lens, very versatile. Many days, this is the only lens I carry. Materials are not as sturdy as lenses of years ago, but it is lighter. Excellent picture quality across all ranges.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Good versatile FX lens
customer_reviews.text: You may hear a lot of photographers putting this lens down. I <<will>> say this is NOT the equivalent of the 18-200 lens for the DX series (that lens is just phenom).....BUT...this is a great versatile lens, and it's on my D800 99% of the time. LR takes care of virtually ALL of the "putdown issues" with auto lens correction...and the end result are images that are incredible rich and sharp. A good workhorse lens for those needing more versatility than being a fashion photographer (which is pretty much everyone else, methinks). :-)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Better than tamron
customer_reviews.text: Good but crazy heavy... Especially if you're a traveler. The quality compared to the Tamron I bought as an option is much better... Much clearer detail. You can't beat the detail. But man, heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for Travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT lens for my Nikon's D600 and D810. I use it for travel. Somewhat heavy and large...but it pretty much covers everything for travel. My old favorite was a 24-120...but this gives me more distance capabilities. I always carry a 1.4 prime lens for inside shots and low light...but the 28-300 covers everything else. Very happy...and I have a truck load of good Nikon lenses.....
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: My go to lens. Excellent quality. Smooth quiet operation.
customer_reviews.text: If you've read reviews of this lens on product review sites then you already know this is a lens you want in your bag. This lens replaced my need to carry others on a quick shoot. It is so versatile and the controls just fit in your hand like a glove. Excellent quality and smooth bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Inventor

customer_reviews.title: It is a great combination of wide angle and zoom
customer_reviews.text: My go to lens for either my D800 or D300. It is a great combination of wide angle and zoom, and when traveling allows me the versatility to capture most any shot on the run. Has great quality of image, no real issues. Very happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Great general use lens
customer_reviews.text: First use out of the box for this was shots around London. The lens range is spectacular. This is paired with a Nikon D750 and the images are striking. I'd absolutely recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morse

customer_reviews.title: My everyday lens.
customer_reviews.text: I needed the preverbal walk around lens and this fits the bill just right. Perfect focal length and is fast enough for everything except the most demanding circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: richpics

customer_reviews.title: My Everything Lens! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional photographer. This is my EVERYTHING lens. I absolutely love it. You can’t beat the warranty you get with purchasing it though here as well. If it breaks at all no matter what, they say they’ll replace it. Image quality is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for walkabout lens
customer_reviews.text: Great overall walk about lens. Tack sharp images whether handheld or on tripod. Autofocus does well with stationary. Have not used for sports or birds yet.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Yankees

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best walk around lens.
customer_reviews.text: I read some less than stellar reviews prior to buying this lens for my new D800. I'm happy to report that, unless you are super critical, this lens is fantastic. Yes, wide open at 28mm, you won't be submitting to National Geographic, but short of that it's a very sharp, versatile lens. Focus is fast, color is good, etc. It will never replace my 70-200 2.8, but it wasn't meant to. If you are looking for a lens that will do it all on your FX body, I highly recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: John Cowgill

customer_reviews.title: Let's take a walk
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel / walkaround lens. I bought this along with the Nikon Z6 just before heading on a photo excursion in Belize. All these examples were taken using the above gear. I let the photos do the talking.
customer_reviews.author: RKHD

customer_reviews.title: Never Leave Home Without This Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Not the sharpest Nikon lens that I have, but I never leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: RFC

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I shoot music venues, and don't have time to be changing lenses. This has just enough zoom that I can get the whole band, and great portraits too.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal-Karma

customer_reviews.title: Good travel lens
customer_reviews.text: A great vacation Lance. I wish I had done a little more research first though and gotten 18 to 300. Otherwise it’s a very good lens. Of course the f-stop is not optimal, but then, I would not have such a lovely compact size for travel
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Becomes walk-around lens most of time for new Nikon D800. Also use DX 85 micro in bag. I have D300s, but love FX, medium format 36 mp of D800. You can see more than you want to see. I've used the combo about 6 months, and only drawback is heft of unit. However, if you want the best pictures you can get, this is it for me. I'm only a dedicated, semi-professional with other means of support, but I go for top line equiptment, and this it for me now. I'm learning every day.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Milne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent do it all lens
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my new D600 and it's a great all around lens. Still prefer my fast primes but if you want to keep your camera bag home and be ready for anything that's reasonably lit well, this is your lens. Unlike my 24-300 DX that I had on my D7000, this lens does not "creep". Seems pretty solid but feels a bit plastic for my taste. For the money, Nikon should really throw in some metal on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Love the flexibility this zoom affords me
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this lens on my 810. I thought I would stay away from zooms and stick with primes when I switched to FF but I found I stopped taking my camera with me on my daily walks. And realized I needed the flexibility of a zoom during those walks - it's primary use for me - here in the NorthEast. I do carry along a 50mm for those times with low light as I'm not sure this lens will function well for me in anything but good daytime light.
customer_reviews.author: RichardTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice all purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: I have both a full frame D610 and cropped frame D7100. This lens works on both though I prefer it on the 7100 since its 1.5 multiplier gives the lens the effective max of 450mm, which works nicely when shooting people in large crowds at events. Not as sharp as the 70-200 2:8, but good for most shots.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Eerdmans

customer_reviews.title: Very good "all terrain" lens
customer_reviews.text: I really love it ! So why not a 5 stars then ? Because of dust inside that affect almost all my photos. I received it with that dust, a small one in the inner lens. But yes it is a really good "all terrain" lens, if you should buy only one lens then this one is the good one. If you re a profesional then you will have luminous f/2.8 lens. I think I've read the famous Scott Kelby saying he uses that lens when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: FCH

customer_reviews.title: I have a 24-70 f/2. 8 and a 70-200 ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24-70 f/2.8 and a 70-200 f/2.8 but lugging them during vacation can be a problem. This lens fits my need when I'm on a family vacation and want to travel light. It's a bit soft though... that would be my only complain.
customer_reviews.author: ANSN

customer_reviews.title: Not for snobs
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lens about a week to compliment my new D850. It's razor sharp, especially f8-f11, autofocus is great, even though it tends to hunt in complete darkness, but most importantly, makes me look like I know what I'm doing. It's not designed for lens geeks. it was designed to take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: George Greven

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S FX Nikkor 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6 ED Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens filled out my requirement for my new Nikon D850 camera. As this has the vibration reduction feature in the lens.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Keyes

customer_reviews.title: This lens is highly rated by everyone, and I agree.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is highly rated by everyone, and I agree. I use it on my Nikon D750. It's not too heavy, and takes great pictures. When I want to take just one lens along for a day of out door shooting, this is the one I take.
customer_reviews.author: edabq

customer_reviews.title: An excellent all purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 18-200 VR DX for the past several years and upgraded my body to a D600. Faced with purchase of a collection of prime lenses I chose the 28-300 VR FX. It is everything the 18-200 and more. The only minor downside is that focus at 300mm is not as sharp as the 70-300. But if I were to have only one lens, the 28-300 would be my first choice
customer_reviews.author: Frank Starmer

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. Combined with my D600 I can hand hold under low light without flash which is perfect for taking pictures of our baby. This lens was well worth the price. I had first bought the 24 mm to 120 mm but sent it back for this one. For the price this lens is much more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Must have go to zoom lens for my D750 very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Al

customer_reviews.title: Exelent lens!
customer_reviews.text: Exellent lens! Because I did not want to expend much money on a lens, I was loosing shooting good pictures with this nikon lens! It worth it to expend your money in a good lens like this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens for travel.
customer_reviews.text: All in one travel lens for landscape, nature, birds, flowers, people ... especially pairs with FX format camera.
customer_reviews.author: Phuoc Le

customer_reviews.title: This is my everyday lens...it’s a reliable workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It is my everyday/ go to lens. I had one for about 4 years and I dropped it on a tile floor and broke it. So I got this one as a replacement. Great for close shots as well as farther away.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is an all purpose lens, light, sharp and powerful enough for most shooting environment. Excellent when you travel and wants to take a lot of pictures under very different environments. It is light enough so it can hang on your neck and take pictures for all day without the need of a supporting monopod. I also carry a smaller wide range 20 mn f2.8 in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Tin WS

customer_reviews.title: it covers most range
customer_reviews.text: Build quality of this lens is very good. Image quality is excellent, VR works with 1/30 of second (i used to get blurred image with my kit lens). One issue is with aperture it reaches 5.6 so quick so you can not use in lowlight much without bumping ISO, that again reduces image quality. Taken images in ZOO and some of the wild life and it comes out really good. I have not changed this lens, it is staying on my camera all the time. I am going to use 50mm 1.8 when i go to aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget fan

customer_reviews.title: Money was refunded
customer_reviews.text: The lense did not focus well but KEH refunded my money with no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am an amateur...... ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur......that said this lens did everything I needed it to do for daytime football pics. I an using it on a d750 and it is exceeing my expectations for 10 foot shots out to about in my estimation 400 feet. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for vacation and backpacking to keep the weight down
customer_reviews.text: This lens does something that is really remarkable: it gives Nikon photographers a single-lens solution that gives good, sharp images from 28-300mm. It's not perfect but for a vacation lens this is the ticket. Auto-focus is good but I would not suggest it for fast motion shots. I shoot with a DX sensor so I have never had an issue with the edge softness that some complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Go to lens!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens!! Very versatile and a must have for all types of photography!! Saves you time and the trouble of switching between lenses. Colors are very vibrant, images are crisp.
customer_reviews.author: rafael leal

customer_reviews.title: Short review, single purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to prepare for an upcoming trip where I will be traveling as light as possible. Previously, I was carrying the "kit" lenses (18-55 and 55-200), and consider myself at the amateur end of photography. This lens is perfect for what I need. The only situation that I have found that the lens struggles at all is low light, and manually focusing this lens is far easier than the kit lenses, so even that is still a plus. Of course, this lens alone was 50% more than the whole kit, so I shouldn't be surprised by that. It meets my full expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Cincinnati Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great lens and very versatile - some distortion and vignetting ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lens and very versatile - some distortion and vignetting but easily corrected. I use this as a great walk-around single lens.
customer_reviews.author: SanjivB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel lens.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens! Perfect for what I wanted, a single lens I can carry with me when traveling. Most of my trips are business-related so I can't be hauling tons of lenses and gear... this lens with the d750 body has proven to be a winning combination! The lens is extremely high quality, no issues at all. It is even smaller in size than the 16-35mm.
customer_reviews.author: ALESSANDRO MENCOS

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Bad in low light but amazing outside. I need to practice landscapes, so far its not as sharp and detailed as I would like. Venting and distortion isn't bad because I have a d750. You can fix it in photoshop. Its a fun lens pretty sharp and decent price. Focus is good and VR is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Mata

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Heavy Ghosting and Chromatic Aberration
customer_reviews.text: Decent images, but not a "Pro" lens. Definitely not worth a $1000 new. Unusable images past 200mm. I wanted to buy a "all in one" lens for certain jobs, instead of carrying my 24-70 and 70-200. This does the job but image quality suffers a lot. The Dehaze slider in LR saves lots of images.
customer_reviews.author: n. m.

customer_reviews.title: A Big Mama
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, but a bit heavy when mounted on a D700, coupled with a SB-800, you need muscles like Atlas to get the job done. This is a FX lens that can be used on a DX body, but it is also to top heavy on the DX body, to feel safe. The quality of the lens is great with good color contrast, sharpness and fast focus.
customer_reviews.author: Constance D., Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition
customer_reviews.text: I had my reservations going in, but after a week in Nicaragua, I am very happy with the results. It is not the best for every situation, but a great tool to have in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Walker

customer_reviews.title: If you have one lens, this is it
customer_reviews.text: I had read good things about this lens, so I had high expectations. I have to say, this is my favorite Nikon full frame lens. When extended, the quality is still excellent. The f-stop flexibility really has helped me create some wonderful images as well
customer_reviews.author: WeHoLancer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lens
customer_reviews.text: The detail that this thing picks up is INCREDIBLE! The zoom is awesome. If you are looking for a great quality photo and a super versatile lens, I highly recommend adding this one to your camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: (Surprisingly) great value for the money and can do just fine ...
customer_reviews.text: (Surprisingly) great value for the money and can do just fine as a light option for hiking (leaving the weighty 2.8's @ home).
customer_reviews.author: ZoomZoom

customer_reviews.title: Love the lens
customer_reviews.text: Received on time, great lens for the price. I'm enjoying capturing photos of the birds & wildlife I use to miss. I am currently using on a DX but I plan to upgrade to the FX format which is why bought the FX lens. I'm an amateur so my technical knowledge about the lens is limited, but I am able to capture photos using manual settings & slow shutter speeds in relatively low light situations, which is the reason I gave it 5 stars. I was shooting with a 18-135 3.5-5.6 previously.
customer_reviews.author: Photogal

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It has not left the camera since I got it. Works in lower light than expected. Crystal clear. Good all-around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for serious amateur Nikon DSRL users.
customer_reviews.text: This new lens is most versatile lens by Nikon, in my opinion. I have many Nikon lenses over 40 years, and this one is the most convenient for my D700 and D750 in everyday and travel shootings.
customer_reviews.author: WLC

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lens on my Nikon D610 and have been impressed with its performance. My one beef is that it's a bit heavy to carry around my neck all day, but it's sharp and the images I get from it are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Pro

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-rang zoom lens!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have taken some really good photos with it. Weight wise, it's about as long a lens as I can manage. I have much to learn about it!
customer_reviews.author: Irene C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Hold
customer_reviews.text: Really like this lens. Shoot alot of action pics. Some times use a 1.4 converter. Easy to hold steady ( Old Man shakes ). Smaller than my 70-200. So far real crisp pics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this lens. The zoom is a little tight as you approach 300 mm, but causes no problems. Pictures are sharp, even at the walls. Weight and balance are very nice and easy to manipulate. I highly recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B. Spaeth

customer_reviews.title: Great carry around lens
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lens that gave me flexibility and range.....this lens did just that. I wasn't concerned with the aperture range being slower, above f2.8, than what I was used to but that's where the increased ISO performance of my D700 & D7100 come into play. This is a great lens for the money - better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great...my favorite team of 17-35 and this unit on my d750 covers everything
customer_reviews.author: William S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens. I have used it twice on sports shoots, with great results. Focusing was extremly easy, even on moving subjects.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great range and  decent sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Short and simple: The very first thing you notice is how heavy this lens is. It is really heavy,but the optics are good and I am very pleased with how sharp the images are. I'm using this lens with my Nikon D7000 and it focus' quickly and well. Images are crisp, even performs well wide open. So, if your looking for a good zoom lens with a longer than average range that won't put you in the poor house, then this is your lens. But again, if you don't like weight hanging around your neck, then pass this lens because the biggest cost is not how much it is, it's how much it weighs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: So far this lens has been a complete joy!. From wide angle to zoom I can ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this lens has been a complete joy!. From wide angle to zoom I can catch everything without swapping lenses. Of course the image quality isn't like that of a 2.8 lens but I'm looking forward to never missing a scene again because I'm too far away or too close. Can't wait to see how it performs with my D4s high ISO ability in low light.
customer_reviews.author: David B Mineer Sr

customer_reviews.title: incredible versatility
customer_reviews.text: Wide angle landscape to distant wildlife and great for people a very versatile single lens when you want great pictures and travel light - using with a D750
customer_reviews.author: Owner builder

customer_reviews.title: a convenient and versatile lens with adequate picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a hobbyist and have purchased this lens when it first came out. It is a very convenient travel lens and allows you to catch "something of everything" and "everything of something". You do not need to worry about changing lenses under dirty or humid conditions or carry several lenses and several bodies (which is what I am doing now) and can enjoy taking pictures. I liked this lens but only used for two months before I purchased the so-called "holy trinity". The clarity of pictures from this 28-300mm is very good, but not as sharp as the f2.8 lenses, esp. under low light. The verdict, a very good and versatile lens, depending on your preference and style.
customer_reviews.author: Lancelot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent All in One Lens.
customer_reviews.text: The lens is fabulous! It focuses accurately and quickly. The picture quality is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Shavers

customer_reviews.title: The focus is not always perfect, I've found that zooming then half press the ...
customer_reviews.text: Versatile, Fast and sharp. The focus is not always perfect, I've found that zooming then half press the shoot button and then un-zooming (in an appropriate lighted area) fixes that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Politick

customer_reviews.title: So glad that I did
customer_reviews.text: I debated for a long time whether to buy this lens for my D800. So glad that I did! It has become my go-to travel lens. Can't image being without it now.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it on D600! Very sharp pictures! It replaced the 18-200DX lenses!
customer_reviews.author: Danny R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: It is a great lens. Most times right on.
customer_reviews.text: I love the 28-300 mm range but sometimes not tack sharp
customer_reviews.author: Jan Gemeinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Want to get in close
customer_reviews.text: Great all around lens. I almost do not need my 24-104 MM lens.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Scirica

customer_reviews.title: ) Love it, it works with D4s and D300s
customer_reviews.text: It's focusing,much faster then older the same lens :) Love it,it works with D4s and D300s.
customer_reviews.author: musician

customer_reviews.title: Great Walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need really fast glass this is a great all around walk around lens. Fast enough for day use covers a huge focal range and has nice contrast in shots. Allows you to carry 1 lens and leave all the others and their weight at home.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Works well with D800. Can be ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Works well with D800. Can be the only lens you need if you just want to spend money on one lens.
customer_reviews.author: Y C Chen

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lens. It's the 18-200 for full frames. It's a good all-around lens. Normally I don't buy aperture shifting lenses, but this is a great all-around lens and I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: G_Phillips

customer_reviews.title: One for all
customer_reviews.text: This is one for all purpose lens for my D3s and soon expected D800E. I do lots of landscaping but filling gap after gorgeous 14-24 2.8 was always difficult. It was end up being 14-24, 24-70, 70-200mm but it always headache to carry those least used two heavy lens. (for landscaping) 28-300mm has extremely useful reach and reduce my back weight by half! Great job Nikon but please make it easy to get... waiting quite a while to get this one....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Composition grand slammer
customer_reviews.text: Great lens to move up to. Started with full-frame Nikon film cameras, then went to DX when it was all I could afford. This lens matches very well with the D800E and Photoshop for cleaning up the minor barrel distortion and vignetting. Hard to beat the images produced, but the real winner is the composition possibilities with this zoom range.
customer_reviews.author: TOMSCH

customer_reviews.title: I received the lens as promised and I have been ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the lens as promised and I have been very please with the lens. It is a very practical lens to have in your arsenal because weight, size and range.
customer_reviews.author: BIKER101

customer_reviews.title: Okay for zoom
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as prime but for zoom is okay
customer_reviews.author: Photo Larry

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it can do everything
customer_reviews.text: So far loving this lens coming from tamron products for my D750. Feels like it can do everything.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Review of Nikon 28 to 300 VR
customer_reviews.text: I have just returned from a trip to Yellowstone with my D800 and the 28 to 300 VR. I'm extremely pleased with the sharpness and contrast and find it an excellent solution for an all around lens. The combination with an extended grip is a little heavy but the lens does all that I expected. Very fast and accurate focus and no flare even into the sun light. Amazon made the purchase and delivery a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: but still like it very much for the
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten the xx-200 mm f/2.8. but still like it very much for the price
customer_reviews.author: Loves to Read

customer_reviews.title: Best Walk Around FX Lens
customer_reviews.text: I hate changing lens, and this lens saves me from changing lens in the field. Yesterday I took pictures of flying birds, and other wild life. My pictures are really clear with great detail. This is my new go every where lens.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bell

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6G ED Vibration Reduction Zoom Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Style:Lens OnlyNikon Fall 2010 New Product Line-up!Nikon AF-S 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6G Nikkor ED VR Lens Features An ideal one-lens solution for FX-format D-SLRs, featuring a broad 10.7X zoom range, close focus to 18 inches at every focal length and VR II image stabilization for handheld shooting at up to 4 shutter speeds slower than would otherwise be possible, assuring dramatically sharper still images and stable video capture. Versatile 10.7x Zoom Lens With ED Glass And VR II Image Stabilization Versatile zoom lens offers a broad focal length range that’s perfect for travel, landscapes, portraits and distant subjects.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 An ideal one-lens solution for FX-format D-SLRs, featuring a broad 10.7x zoom range, close focus to 18 inches at every focal length and VR II image stabilization for handheld shooting at up to 4 shutter speeds slower than would otherwise be possible, assuring dramatically sharper still images and stable video capture. 

Nikon AF-S Nikkor 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR Lens Highlights 



Sample photo taken with the Nikkor 28-300mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR lens. 
Versatile 10.7x zoom lens with ED glass and VR II image stabilization
Versatile zoom lens offers a broad focal length range that's perfect for travel, landscapes, portraits and distant subjects. 

Optimized for edge to edge sharpness on both FX and DX-format D-SLRs
DX-format D-SLR angle of view is equivalent to a focal length of 42-450mm in FX/35mm format. 

Nikon VR II (Vibration Reduction) Image Stabilization 
Vibration Reduction, engineered specifically for each VR NIKKOR lens, enables handheld shooting at up to 4 shutter speeds slower than would otherwise be possible, assuring dramatically sharper still images and video capture. 

2 Extra-low Dispersion (ED) Elements
Offers superior sharpness and color correction by effectively minimizing chromatic aberration, even at the widest aperture settings. 

3 Aspherical Lens Elements
Virtually eliminates coma and other aberrations, even at wide apertures. 


Exclusive Nikon Silent Wave Motor (SWM) 
Enables fast, accurate and quiet autofocus. 

M/A Focus Mode Switch
Enables quick changes between manual and autofocus operation. 

Internal Focus (IF)
Provides fast and quiet autofocus without changing the length of the lens, retaining working distance throughout the focus range. 

Nikon Super Integrated Coating (SIC)
Enhances light transmission efficiency and offers superior color consistency and reduced flare. 

Zoom Lock Switch
Secures the lens barrel at its minimum focal length preventing the lens from extending during transport. 
Focus to 18 inches at any focal length
Extends versatility. 

Rounded 9-Blade Diaphragm
Renders more natural appearance of out-of-focus image areas. 


MTF Charts
feature_bullets: Versatile 107x zoom lens with ED glass and VR II image stabilization
Optimized for edge to edge sharpness on both FX and DX-format
Covers a wide range of focal lengths to get the best out of every subject. Minimum Focus Distance- 1.6 ft. (0.5m) throughout entire zoom range
2 Extra-low Dispersion (ED) Elements; 3 Aspherical Lens Elements
Exclusive Nikon Silent Wave Motor (SWM) Weight : 282 oz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars719 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
